metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8668 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the PackBitsPreEncode function in tif_packbits.c in bmp2tiff in libtiff 4.0.6 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a large width field in a BMP image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream removed the bmp2tiff utility in 4.0.7 RHEL patch is incomplete

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
